intro: Psychotria nervosa var. hirta, commonly known as the hairy psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white to pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The species is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and is known for its ecological importance in supporting local biodiversity.
